intro: Tricalysia pachystigma var. praecox, commonly known as the early-flowering tricalysia, is a tropical shrub native to West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, elliptical fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
